intro: Sciadotenia brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed sciadotenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Sciadotenia brachypoda is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and swampy areas.
